Reviews.Title: “perfect place off the beach right in town clean comfortable and new”
Reviews.Author: DJBSFO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my way to Tulum... emailed Matt (one of the owners I believe) and he was great in getting back to me and offered me a great 1 night deal.... the hotel is new clean and 15 steps from the busy walking street which is the center of nightlife in Playa Del Carmen. I read tons of reviews on hotels and many complained about noise. I seem to get a courtyard room where even on a Saturday night the noise was minimal, slight sound of a Cuban band at a neighboring cafe. I was checked in by a friendly guy from St Lucia and was able to park my car right in front of the hotel. This place is great clean comfortable and free wifi which worked fine. There seems to be a lot of choices in PDC some hip some basic and some well priced and comfortable like Acanto Condo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Playa Del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: KimT300112
Reviews.Content: We visited this great spot Feb.12-19th, and found the location to be ideal. We were looking for a place where we could walk to everything, having made the decision to try something new, and not stay in a All Inclusive. We found the Acanto to be ideally located in the heart of everything, allowing us to dine somewhere different every evening all within walking distance. Returning to our apartment, at all times of the day, we found it to be very peaceful and tranquil, and enjoyed lounging in their courtyard or our private rooftop terrace. The beach is a short walk away, approx. 1 block , to a very busy,lively section of beach,which you can walk endlessly to quieter areas if that is your preference. We had a great week, at this lovely boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great people, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: DShawnW
Reviews.Content: Acanto is located very near the middle of 5th Avenue where there are hundreds of restaurants and stores. This is a pedestrian street packed with people every night and on some nights the artists will display their talents. If you unsure where you want to eat just start walking until you find what you are in the mood for. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are quiet and very clean and recently renovated. All of the furniture & full kitchens are brand new. The private balconies (with hot tubs & gas grills) on the top floor offer marvelous vistas and a great place to get some sun if its to windy on the beach. The beach is 1.5 blocks away with many beach clubs within a short walk from there. The people working at Acanto are very friendly and efficient. If you are not into All-Inclusives, this condos provide a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you need to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL M
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say, except if you come to playa del carmen and dont stay here you're crazy. The place is brand new, clean, safe, quite and beautiful. It also is in a great location, in the center of everything, but just far enough away you don't hear any loud clubs or people out late. It is tucked away perfectly. I would tell anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people!, great location”
Reviews.Author: Shiana86
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean rooms Great staff Great location Bed pillows were excellent :) Very low pressure in the showers 2 english channels on TV NO SMOKING ANYWHERE allowed, you have to go outside the resort to the side of the road No WIFI i had to pay for it daily $10 Other than that, nice place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Damien K
Reviews.Content: We went with a friend, my wife and our 14 month old baby and rented a 2 bedroom apt for 7 days. Location was great (close to the beach and all the restaurants and bars) as well as clean and spacious. The staff was very helpful and always very nice with us. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: -ktabroad-
Reviews.Content: Acanto is in a prime location just metres from 5th avenue and a short stroll to the beach. Despite its proximity to 5th Ave the hotel provides a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Newly renovated, the rooms are very comfortable and well maintained. We stayed for 10 days in February and March in one of the penthouse rooms with our young children aged 8 & 4. The staff were amazing and went out of their way to help us. They always responded quickly and efficiently to any questions or issues we had. Our apartment faced 16th but we were never kept awake by the noise. One night a Mariachi band played outside our window at Sirenas and while it was noisy, it was still early (around 9pm) and they played for about 10 minutes. It was fabulous watching them from our balcony. I guess if we had wanted complete quiet we would have chosen a location much further from the 5th ave throngs! Even though there were four of us in the apartment we didn't have problems with the hot water. The maids did an excellent job cleaning the apartment each day. One of the air-conditioners wasn't working when we arrived but the staff followed up immediately and provided regular updates about when the repair people would arrive and how quickly it could be fixed. We swam in the pool every day and it was always clean - the staff were constantly scooping leaves. The new cafe opened while we were there (I think we were their first official customers!) and we had breakfast there each day for the last few days of our stay. It was excellent and I would definitely recommend eating there. We also shopped at Mega and used the apartment's facilities to make our our own breakfasts. We used the hotel's Transfer/Tour service. Antonio collected us from and dropped us at the airport and also arranged a guided tour to Chichen Itza. The service was outstanding and excellent value. He happily accommodated our request for a diversion on the way back to Valladolid for lunch and our guide, Sergio, also adapted the tour to suit the age of our little girls. We would highly recommend the Acanto and would happily book again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Clean Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann V
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my first trip to Mexico that was not all-inclusive. We stayed in a studio penthouse and while it was not as big as we had envisioned, it was sufficient for our needs. We booked "room and breakfast" through Expedia and although this was a surprise to the hotel, they kindly obliged and we had a simple but filling breakfast sent to our room on the days we requested. I do hope this issue has been resolved with Expedia. The hotel is an easy 3 minute walk to the beach. They provide nice large beach towels. The pool gets minimal sun but is still pleasant for an afternoon dip. Daily, we saw cleaning and maintenance crews working diligently to keep the grounds looking attractive. We did fall asleep every night to the sounds of music from 5th Avenue, but is was jazzy and soft from a nearby restaurant and I really didn't mind. The rooftop patio has a beautiful view of the ocean and is nice to just go to, sit and enjoy the ocean breeze when your beach day is over. Our room did have a private rooftop Jacuzzi as well, but it was kind-of a joke, we couldn't get the water to heat up enough to really enjoy it and when it was at its warmest, the jets wouldn't turn on. If you are looking for some restaurants that aren't quite so "touristy" ask the concierge about Cactus or UTIL Pasta Factory, we were lucky enough to learn about them from some visitors who had been there a month...and they were the best places we ate at all week! You will want to make reservations though! All in all, we were happy with the hotel and will consider it again on our return trip to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm giving this hotel a Rating of 1 is that I couldn't give it a 0. I've been to Playa 5 times over the past couple of years. This was my first stay at Acanto and will be my last. Here is an objective review of this property: Pros: New. Condo-style apartments. Convenient location. Friendly staff (but so are the staff in any other hotel in Playa). Cons: Construction was NOT complete when we arrived. I repeat: NOT complete. We had to wake up to drill and hammer noise every morning! Of the 7 night stay at Acanto, the apartment was cleaned 3 days and the maids "forgot" to clean the apartment 4 other days. There was NEVER any soap or shampoo in the hotel throughout the entire stay. On 2 mornings, there was NO water in the apartment. Every day, a choice had to be made between taking a warm shower or shaving with warm water as the hot water can't last for both shower and shaving! If there are more than 2 people staying in the apartment, then good luck with having enough warm water to just shower. The hotel does NOT have a beach lounge, despite what the pictures show. It is simply close to the beach (just like all other hotels in Playa). While the staff was friendly, they were incompetent. To get something done, you have to request it at least 3 times- example getting toilet paper. While the hotel looks nice and is built like a boutique condo, the insulation is terrible, and you can never get a good night sleep as you can hear people outside your apartment all night and morning- walking up the stairs, taking the elevator, the maids chatting with each other, etc. While the pool looks nice, it is tiny and is exactly behind the reception desk overlooking the street. This does not make it a great place to relax given all the traffic in and out of the hotel and people at the reception. Also, don't count on having sunshine in the pool area for an extended period of time as the hotel is constructed such that the shadow from the building will soon cover the pool area. Also, you have to grab beach towels before 11 am otherwise, you're out of luck as the towels are gone by then. Overall, the hotel seems to promise more than it really delivers. Stay at Acanto at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil boutique hotel - great for families”
Reviews.Author: Vik D
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Playa Del Carmen, and 3rd time to the Cancun/Rivera Maya area. We travelled with our 5 month old daughter and 2 friends for 7 nights and got a 2 bedroom apartment thru Expedia (best price). Before leaving the U.S., Joel called me to place us in an apartment on the main floor, so we wouldn't have a tough time with the stroller - very nice. The apartment was beautiful (Rm 3) - this hotel is fully renovated as of Dec 2011, all stainless appliances, granite countertops and showers, LCD TVs. Our TV wasn't working but they fixed it the same day for us. You have several Amercian channels like TNT, Universal, and a few other free cable movie channels. The 2 bedroom apartment has 2 bathrooms which was a plus. The facility is kept extremely clean, and they are always cleaning the pool of leaves and seeds. The cleaning staff did a nice job every day in the rooms. There's plenty of silverware and cups and plates for you to use. If you don't wash them then the cleaning staff will (though we did it ourselves because that's the right thing to do). We needed a stove pot to boil water for the baby bottles and they happily gave us one - the cooking utensils are minimal but if you need anything additional, just ask for it (don't buy it at a store like another review said). The location is perfect - right off 5th Ave, right in the middle of the 5th ave strip on 16th st. I felt like if we stayed further south off 5th Ave it wouldn't have been as nice. Security at night was nice, and made us feel safe (though PDC is very safe in general). Breakfast was very good across the street at Sirena, and included in our price - eggs, fruit, club sandwiches, toast, etc. Get your coffee at Starbucks, and get the fresh squeezed orange juice instead. Sirena is good for a quick dinner if you like as well. I guess the restaurant next door isn't ready yet, because it was only open 1 day. I recommend that you walk to the local supermarket "Mega" (it's huge and just like Shoprite, Waldbaum's or A&P in the U.S.). Get your water, juice, bread, snacks all there and then take a $3 cab back to the hotel. There's a Walmart nearby as well. The rooftop of the hotel has a BBQs and jacuzzi's, which was awesome. We reserved it one night and grilled chicken, chorizo and burgers up there and brought an iPod dock for entertainment. The sunset from the rooftop is amazing! There is a new elevator which worked just fine for us. Raphela, Joel and Luis were accommodating and very helpful. They helped us book a car on the last day by searching on the internet and calling places for us. We went to the Tulum ruins and also toured the town of Tulum's boutique hotel strip down there (amazing beaches!!). Check our Rosa Viento towards the end of the strip - Miguel is the best there. Pros: Location (16th St and 5th Ave), newly renovated hotel, very comfortable king beds, BBQ and jacuzzi rooftop, great staff, tranquil, full kitchen, dining and living room space, bathroom in each bedroom, 1 block from the beach, nice small pool. WIFI in the lobby and also available in each room. Cons: As Playa del Carmen is full of nice boutique hotels, this is one of the best. Don't expect grand hotel luxury like room service - for that, you need to stay at a large resort which we didn't want to, as they are not downtown where you want to be. This isn't really a con, but you should be aware. Rivera Maya has alot of mosquitos so be sure to bring OFF! bug spray and you will be fine. Nice to have: Showers could use more water pressure, but otherwise they were fine. The water all over Playa Del Carmen in alittle salty - I believe the city processes seawater into normal water - we got used to it, no big deal. Recommendations: When getting breakfast in the morning, always request prepaid passes for the restaurant Sirena across the street and never goto Indigo for food (it's the worst). Restaurants - La Parilla (mexican), 10 (Diez - argentian steakhouse); Bars/Clubs - Mandala (insane!), Fusion (fireshow); Beach clubs - La Mamitas, Kool, Wicky's, Sensi. Anything you buy, negotiate half off!! Go to the 7Eleven near 12th St and use the HSBC ATM inside to get Pesos ($1USD = $13 pesos). Pay for everything in pesos and you will save a ton of cash and credit card foreign transaction fees. Use Expedia (Best Day Travel) or the hotel directly for transportation to/from the airport for best price and peace of mind. Use the WIFI on your cellphone at the hotel for Skype phone calls, much cheaper than international cell phone roaming. Remember 2 things - Everyone is on Mexican Standard Time down here, ie. service literally takes 2x or 3x the time. You will order food or drinks and they will come like 30 minutes later. Lastly, rule of thumb is to always be nice in spite of frustration - if you're nice, you will be taken care of much faster than if you are rude!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place & deal”
Reviews.Author: SFOPeter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights with my son in a 2 bedroom condo. We loved the location near 5th with all of its restaurants and how close it was to the beach. Condo was new construction and well built and comparable to luxury hotels. Tech was great with flat screens in every room with a lot of cable channels, and lots of highspeed wifi hotspots that worked well. The staff was very nice and helped us with restaurant and scuba recommendations and let us have a 2 hour late checkout. Only thing we didn't like was that the couches in the living room were too hard. And the guests before us stole the batteries out of 2 of the TV remote controls. Doh! Next time I would pay the extra for a penthouse per the other reviews here on TripAdvisor, it is not that much more and would have been nice to have a bit more light and views of the ocean. Tip: the beach is nicer if you walk a block to the left past the pier. Acanto definitely met my expectations of a luxury condo rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: platinum4life
Reviews.Content: I have watched them build the Acanto Hotel for the last year or so as it sits directly across from the condo that I have been renting for the last five years (Puerto Playa Condo's). If you are familiar with that property then you know the location is hard to beat. The design and layout of the Acanto is very cool and since the property is new, everthing is in good working order. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Wireless worked good in the room and the one bedrooms have kitchens that are equiped with most things you need. Overall it is a great location for not being directly on the beach ( one block over) and right off of 5th Avenue and a good location also on 5th. With all of the issues you hear about Mexico, Playa is one of the safest. There are tons of people there from all over the world having a great time and as one who travels to Mexico about seven + times per year, this is still one of the best places for the beach and great food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Acanto 1/28/12 - 2/5/12”
Reviews.Author: saozz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to all of the shopping and dining. Staff were very friendly and helpful, with a special mention to Joel, who seemed to be there 24 hours a day. The rooms were great, highly recommend getting one of the penthouses with the private jacuzzi on the roof. Can't say enough good things about our stay, can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful family holiday!”
Reviews.Author: nestas
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, including sons 20 & 24, was very pleased and comfortable during our 6 night stay at the Acanto Boutique Hotel. It was our first trip to the area. We decided on Playa del Carmen vs Cancun and debated as to staying in an all-inclusive but opted for the condo instead. This was a good decision as we saw more of each other, enjoyed a few meals in the condo (food shopping at nearby Mega Store was convenient), and delighted in choosing from the endless availability of fine restaurants nearby. The Acanto is steps to 5th Av and proximity to the beach made our holiday (without a car) perfect! The street is quiet, though we occasionally heard music late at night (from 5th Ave)... but it was a high peak time after Christmas and through New Year's Day. I would recommend the Acanto Hotel because it was clean, convenient and mostly for the amazing service of the staff. They were responsive and accommodating. (especially Joel & Luis) We hired the driver affiliated with the hotel and Antonio made our trip exceptional (see attached picture). Antonio (business is Cancun-Shuttle-DIrect) transported us to and from Cancun airport as well as a private full day trip to Tulum, lunch at Oscar & Lalo's Restaurant and to the quiet, idyllic Ecopark Kantun-Chi where we enjoyed swimming in the cenotes (5)! Antonio knew where to go and would show anyone a good time, regardless of their interests. The condo unit was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable, though the hot water supply in our shower was insufficient. We also felt that the kitchen could have been supplied with a few basics, (paper towels, dishwasher soap, ice cube trays, coffee filters, dish towels, steak knives, salt & pepper). As The Acanto has recently reopened (after complete renovations), perhaps these have been remedied. Maid service was exceptional, too. The cost was a bit high though opting for a private bedroom and bath for the boys made it special and luxurious for all. I would definitely stay here again, though with another couple or two to share the cost. Thanks, Acanto, for making our family holiday one we'll never forget!

Reviews.Title: “10 Days In Playa”
Reviews.Author: DAR0727
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to return to Playa for a 10 day holiday at the end of January. We have vacationed several times in Jamaica, and will continue to do so, however we wanted to try something different than an all inclusive holiday. The Acanto was the perfect choice. Not more that 20 steps to 5th Avenue, the location was central both to to the beach (highly recommend Kool Beach Club) and to great dining and shopping options on 5th avenue. We had requested a one bedroom penthouse, however, one was not available at the time the reservation was made. Joel and Rafaela "worked their magic" and by day 3 we were ensconced in a penthouse suite - rooftop private jacuzzi, private dining area and BBQ with the water of Playa as a backdrop! The beauty of the Acanto is you can decide whether you wish to dine in using kitchen/BBQ or head out to one of the many great restaurants close by. If you opt to prepare meals, the Mega store is close by and is well stocked with anything you might require. Our condo unit was well laid out, nicely furnished with ample towels and hot water. As mentioned previously Joel and Rafaela work very hard to ensure great guest experience. We will be returning to Playa ...and to the Acanto!

Reviews.Title: “Acanto Hotel 2/2/12 to 2/6/12”
Reviews.Author: b007s
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Acanto Hotel. With a group of five, we stayed in two rooms: a 2BR penthouse condo and a 1BR penthouse condo, both in the main building (apparently there's another condo location a few blocks away). It was a good configuration, because we were able to cook and really had some space to spread out. Our group had some very specific needs, so I communicated with the Acanto staff several times in advance about details. They responded right away, and were super accommodating about things like making sure both bedrooms in the 2br penthouse had queen or king beds (not twins), and answering questions about local resources. The penthouse roof terraces were especially lovely -- each one included a four-person hot tub, table/chairs and loungers, and an outdoor kitchen area with gas grill, sink, and counter space. (The railing-free spiral stairs to the roof are a little scary, though!) The hotel is one longish block from the ocean, and the setting feels more "town" than "beachfront," but our view was pretty nice from up there! The beach itself has the kind of fine, light, powdery sand that dreams are made of. You can walk all the way up either the beach or the main pedestrian drag (Avenida 5) from near the hotel to the Cozumel ferry building, and there are endless resources for entertainment, dining/drinking, etc. along either route. We bought groceries at Walmart and later at Mega Mart (which is much better and closer), but you can also preorder groceries from the hotel and they'll deliver them to your room for a 20% surcharge, which seems like a pretty good deal. At our request, Acanto also made reservations for us one night at Yaxche, a great Mayan restaurant a few blocks away. Yum! The Acanto Hotel is very newly redone, so there were occasional glitches, like the elevator not working for a few days (it also doesn't go to all upper-floor areas), and no phones in the rooms to call downstairs or to other rooms. There were also a few byzantine little quirks to the facility -- for example, they have to turn on the hot tubs and the rooftop grills for you in advance (you can't just do it yourself, and you have to plan ahead). And because the hotel is at the edge of Avenida 5, there was a bit of wee-hours noise from carousing tourists returning drunk to wherever they were staying (this only happened a couple times over the weekend). But overall it was pretty quiet, and felt very private and relaxed. The vibe was great, the decor nice (especially the wall art), the location excellent, the beds very comfortable, the Wi-Fi ($10/day) reliable, and the onsite staff were some of the nicest, most accommodating people I've encountered at any hotel worldwide. Joel deserves a medal for all his hard work -- it seemed like he was ALWAYS there to help!

Reviews.Title: “Relax and Renew”
Reviews.Author: Roberta S
Reviews.Content: This brand new boutique hotel built around a central courtyard with a delightful plunge pool and open air evening cocktail space is just delightful. From the moment you enter the breezy open lobby and meet Joel/Rafaela or Luis you know you are in good hands. We were fortunate enough to have Room 14 which is a Penthouse with a private rooftop. The room was spacious and well appointed with dining area, full kitchen, flat screen TV and enough kitchen equipment to satisfy the basics (I didn't cook...it was a vacation!). The bedroom also had its own flat screen and plenty of storage. The bed was very comfortable! The bathroom was just the way I like it, tiled, new and a shower with plenty of hot water. Our rooftop space was large enough for a full built in bbq unit (stainless steel and still unused!) with wet bar, sink and lots of counter space. We had a table and four chairs, two lounge chairs and a hot tub that was at the ready....the view of the stars and the beach just couldn't be beat. It was also the perfect spot for that late afternoon book/magazine/cocktail when you have had enough of the beach scene and just want some private quiet. There were always clean towels for showers or beach and Joel/Rafaela/Luis couldn't have been more helpful with all our requests...dinner suggestions, day trips or which beach was the best! Playa del Carmen has great shopping, beautiful beaches, lovely restaurants and the location of Acanto made all this accessible with or without a car...someone recently asked me if they needed shoes...and I said NO! We did see several other rooms at the hotel and the two and three bedroom suites would easily accommodate several couples on a holiday or the 'Girls' or a family that needs some space. But we loved Penthouse 14 and our private rooftop....

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best !!”
Reviews.Author: shosho_9
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing visit at the beginning of the year . Our group of four were wowed by the amazing service and hospitality we received . Special thanks to Joel for going out of his way, making our stay so comfortable and enjoyable . We have recommended this property to our friends and family and cannot wait to return !!

Reviews.Title: “Condominiums with Style and True Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: soundsation
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in Playa Del Carmen. Our check-in agent made us feel very welcome. We found our condominium to be brand new, clean, fully-furnished, beautifully constructed, and well-designed. Throughout our stay, the housekeeping employees performed all cleaning tasks exceptionally well. They were unobtrusive, flexible with our schedule, thorough, and detail-oriented. For being in such a prime location, I was surprised at how quiet and peaceful the rooms were. We appreciated consistently comfortable slumbers. What especially impressed me at Acanto Hotel and Condominiums was each staff member. Each one was so helpful in answering all the questions I had at any time of day. We appreciated the 24-hour security, too. Acanto Hotel representatives helped me coordinate car rentals, dining arrangements, and taxis with ease and competitive pricing in a polite, helpful, and pleasant manner. Guest services were superior, and the atmosphere of true hospitality was a class act. We hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Acanto”
Reviews.Author: claire19841987
Reviews.Content: We are renting a 1 bedroom condo for a 6 week period at Acanto and we are very happy with our selection. We had exchanged several emails prior to confirming our stay and the description of the services and amenities are as promised. The location is excellent since it's a block away from the beach and near a multitude of restaurants, shopping, Mega, etc. Our condo was ready and very clean. It is very nicely furnished and the king size bed is very comfortable. The courtyard and common areas are kept very clean and are well maintained. The staff is very professional, fluent in english and very eager to please their guests. Any questions or requests made were quickly attended to by the staff and manager. The jaccuzi was always ready and clean when requested. The staff is available to reserve tours or restaurant reservations. A significant discount is available for the new gym located a few steps away from the condo. A minor suggestion would to add to the kitcheware such as no of dishes, ustensils, bowls, etc We would recommend this hotel with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Go have a great time!”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: A large group of my family just returned from the best vacation in years. Much of the enjoyment can be attributed to the Property and Staff of the Acanto Boutique Hotel/Condos. The suites, we had 2 and 3 bedroom units, were large, well decorated and furnished comfortably. As it has been newly renovated, a few minor gliches arose; but those were taken care in moments without disturbing us too much. The roof top hot tubs were clean and refreshing after a day on the beach, only 2 blocks away. 25 resturaunts of all types within 5 minutes walking from the hotel. No language barriers with the day staff, although the night attendent did not speak much English. He was still able to assist as needed. We (the 17of us) will surely keep this location on the top of our list for places to stay in Playa del Carmen. One of the best things was no sales pitch for any of the available units.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay for people of all ages. Located just off of 5th Ave, and just a few steps from the beach. As a family of 5, the 2 bed/2 bath was a perfect amount of space. Every single staff member was accommodating, friendly and more than willing to help us have a great stay - excellent hospitality service. The hotel staff had great recommendations for everything including where to stay on the beach, what to do for kids/activities during the day, for food. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a very relaxing hotel for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: emhh
Reviews.Content: According to Hotels.com and Acanto's own website, the hotel seems quite perfect. It is pricier than others but we were prepared to pay this, as we expected top service and an easy-going time in Playa del Carmen. We were terribly disappointed due to numerous issues, which piled up as an unsatisfactory experience. First, according to the reservation from Hotels.com we had breakfast included. However, the hotel claimed they received no information about this and after a few days demanded us to pay for breakfasts. Second, the building/renovation was nowhere near done. The room was (almost) ready but some others were not and paint smell and noises were present in common areas. In our room items were obviously just removed from a package or they were still on one. Third, we lacked enough information about hotel procedures as the room had no information file or instructions about roof top common areas, safety locker, deals with beach clubs, local sights etc. In addition, there was no phone in the room (even though according to the Hotels.com there was supposed to be one) so we had to walk to the reception for every issue. When asking about this, we were explained that the hotel is such a small venue the rooms don't need a phone. All in all, the most disturbing experience was that some of the issues listed in Hotels.com or Acanto's own webpages were missing or claimed not be included (breakfast, bottled water, slippers, phone, even though they were supposed to), which caused an uneasy feeling when discussing with the personnel. We ended up having a not very relaxing holiday trying to solve the problems. In the end the most serious issues were solved. However, it took several discussions over more than one day. To say something nice about the hotel, the location is excellent and cleaning worked well and maids were very friendly. I hope others' stays after us are better and the service is improved.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Acanto for NYE & BPM”
Reviews.Author: Justin D
Reviews.Content: A newly renovated hotel hotel, it is right in the heart of Playa, an all around fantastic location. Eventhough it is right off 5th, it is very quiet. Definitely a plus to have separate bedrooms too. The suites were very well appointed. I would absolutely consider staying there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “acanto stay during BPM”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Beautiful- very relaxing- and the setup is perfect- steps from all restaurants and 2 blocks from beach-we had 2 rooms with 2 beds in each- had plenty of room- would def stay next year for the BPM again- although we didnt use it much- had a nice sundeck with jacuzzi

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yabby2000
Reviews.Content: A fantastic choice. Had a wonderful stay there. Courteous and helpful staff right in the heart of playa. Clean new rooms and bath with very comfortable beds. Would 100% stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay at the Acanto”
Reviews.Author: MYB_VP
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay, beach club access, spa, shopping, entertainment and food right across the street and around every corner. Our accommodations were awesome with a full kitchen, 3 full baths, 3 bed rooms, our balcony looked over the pool. The staff was excellent they went over and above to make sure that we had everything we needed, including picking up and delivering food to our unit. They made the trip very enjoyable. Our unit was set-up so that we each had our own space and allowed space to work. I would definitely stay again in a heartbeat. We kidded about making this our corporate headquarters, but in all reality someday it might happen, it certainly filled all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “our second retreat”
Reviews.Author: xhibtz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Christmas & New year getaway. My wife just can't stop talking to her friends and family about Acanto Boutique Hotel. This is our first trip since the their renovations. What can we say we thought is was great before it's even better. The location was great and the beach club and their discount cards for the beach clubs and various restaurants..Also the furnishings and new amenities were amazing we even had a private chef come in and cook for us and was served by a candlelit dinner on the roof top. For those who want getaway like the stars they need to make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Playa and Loved the Acanto”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: I wish I was able to stay longer at The Acanto. Went with my new girl friend and got a great deal on a Penthouse Suite that had a PVT roof terrace with PVT Hot tub that was just heaven at sunset. The staff was very helpful in sending us to some great local restaurants and tippe us off to particiapte in the Acanto's twitter speical offer and scored one free night. Was VERY happy with hotel and would highly reccommend to go for the Penthouse suites for sure

Reviews.Title: “your best bet in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: markbogdanos
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Playa Del Carmen since the mid 90's. This quaint and charming Beautifully designed and appointed hotel offers the best of "Playa" at reasonable prices. I have stayed at many of the resort hotels but none of them allow the freedom to experience the true allure and captivating charm of this beautiful and uniquely accessible Paraiso. With it's fabulous location and tremendous Cosmopolitan hospitality I could not imagine staying anywhere else in Playa. I was there Christmas week 2011 and will be returning next month. To be able to have my "apartment" in this location is really the best of all worlds. Playa i meant to be enjoyed and The Acanto makes that effortlessly and abundantly a reality. Any negative reviews really miss the big picture. This place has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Z-Canadian-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We were super excited to book at Acanto Boutique Hotel for our stay over the New Year. We booked for 6 nights and stayed in a 2 bed room suite with another couple. The suite we stayed in was very spacious and the layout/design was nice. It was very clear upon arrival that they were not ready for us to check in as the maids were still cleaning when we arrived. We also noticed that the hotel was still under construction. I wasn't too bothered by this at first however, for the next couple of days construction began early in the morning and we were unable to sleep. Our room had a separate entrance and a balcony that faced the common area which appeared to convenient at first however we quickly noticed that neither of these entrances were sound proof. We barely got any sleep and always were awaken early due to the noise from the other guests. The elevator bell is pretty loud and every time it stops on the floor that makes a loud noise that we can hear in the suite (make sure you don't get a suite by the elevator because it is also a high traffic area). Hot water was also an issue. By the time one person finishes their shower the hot water tank is already empty. We had to plan the timing of our showers so that we each got hot water. Twice during our stay we woke up and there was no running water in the suite. Housekeeping was also a big problem. Almost everyday housekeeping would clean in the early evening. We would come home from the beach around 5:00 pm and the rooms still weren't clean. We never received any soap from the moment we got here -even though we asked everyday. Two of the days they ran out of towels and almost everyday they didn't put any toilet paper and Kleenex in at least one of the bathrooms. One day the maids did one bedroom and didn't clean the other room. As for the hotel pool, the pictures are very deceiving. The pool is tiny and inconveniently situated. The front staff was friendly and helpful to the extent that they could be given all the circumstances. The location of the hotel is the big highlight as it is very convenient. This was the one saving grace. I think that this hotel needs to get their service together. It definitely has potential but I would never stay here again and wouldn’t recommend this place to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely :)”
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: Great location..hotel is beautiful. But it is brand new and still needs some work to be done. We didnt have a phone in our villa and make sure your showers our quick because the water turns cold after 5 minutes! Other then that the management was excellent and the people e were so nice and accomodating. They gave us a GREAT deal and i would def recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: I was referred to Acanto by a friend of mine who also went and loved it...I went with a couple of girlfriends..Our room was overlooking the ocean, we had a fully equipped kitchen and a well stocked refrigerator which the hotel arranged for us before we got there. We were in walking distance from beach, local stores and restaurants. The hotel was beautifully designed and decorated. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We all enjoyed our stay at Acanto and would definitely recommend it..Can't wait to go back with my family...

Reviews.Title: “We are repeat visitors!”
Reviews.Author: EdEnck
Reviews.Content: The Acanto is all new and reborn! You have to check it out. Roof deck views of the ocean from the hot tub! Breakfast on your private patio and lunch at the nicest beach club in town. Full Kitchen makes traveling on a budget easy or have the dinner catered in you room. 1 block to the beach without the beach club techno noise.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Lschreiter
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough great things about this beautiful little hotel!!! Our accommodations were impeccable. Full kitchen, 3 full baths with beautifully tiled showers, 3 bed rooms, and a belcony overlooking the pool. I will never be able to say enough great things about the staff!!! They are friendly, efficient, and willing to bend over backwards to help and make your stay more comfortable. My trip would not have been as enjoyable without them! One night they even went out picked up our dinner and set it up beautifully on our balcony with flowers and candle light! it truly is a special place. I would stay their again in a heartbeat. It has stunning rooftop views of the ocean, is footsteps from killer restaurants and fun tourist shopping, and their pool/lounge area is quaint an relaxing. The time I spent their felt like I was in a storybook-- but I'm SO glad it was real life.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Get-A-Way”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in town for a photoshoot. After a long day of shooting...we were just exhausted and when we returned "home" it was like entering an amazing get-a-way lit by candle lite. What a peaceful place to stay. The staff was amazing and always there for you ..."even if you need just the smallest thing" as they used there hands showing us. With the main shopping and dinning scene just steps out the door - there was always entertainment near by. We did not make it to the beach, as we just ran out of time, but with it only being a block away, we are sure to make it there next time! We were sad to leave and are anxioulsy awaiting to return! Thank you for such a great time! Laura Taylor, Model Your Brand - Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Estrella58
Reviews.Content: The best vacations in Playa del Carmen, rooms are very big and with luxury standards, the location was very convenient in the middle of all Playa del Carmen atractions, the staff was very helpful and friendly, we loved our super equiped 3 bedroom pent-house with all the facilities for a large family. The hotel is very private and quiet, in the sorroundings you will find lots of fun and entertainment, we will definitely go back for holidays!

Reviews.Title: “SOUTH BEACH LUXURY IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN”
Reviews.Author: xhibtz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 5 star hotels in and out of the United States. Acanto is our favorite.From the time you enter until the time you leave the service, the staff,the accommodations and everything they offer is number 1 in our book. My wife and I plan on returning for our anniversary. Acanto is just one great getaway. i only wish it was closer. I referred Aconto to some of my friends and they couldn't thank me enough.

Reviews.Title: “The Romantic Acanto”
Reviews.Author: EdEnck
Reviews.Content: Our favorite romantic get away! Cool vibe and roof deck. Nice pool caring staff. The perfect vacation destination. 1/2 Block from the beach and 1/2 Block to 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Place, one block from the beach, and in the center of the night life.”
Reviews.Author: dhassoncpa
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully furnished. Well-located.Very personal, I would recommend this as a private boutique hotel.
